sentences: Lori Reina Goldstein (born May 13, 1975, in the Bronx, New York City, United States) is an American female dance-pop singer-songwriter.
In 1995, she released a self-titled R&B album as Lori Gold, and had a minor hit with "I Likes".
In 1998, as Reina, she became an overnight sensation on the Dance/Club scene when "Find Another Woman" reached No. 2 on the Billboard Hot Dance Music/Club Play chart.
In 2003, she scored her biggest hit on the Billboard
In 2004 when "If I Close My Eyes" went to number 2 on Billboard's Dance/Mix Show Airplay chart, she garnered her biggest dance hit and in 2005 scored another top 5 on the same chart with "Forgive".
"Vivo per Lei"(with Angelo Venuto and The Sicilians; 2003)
